N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 90.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

For the purposes of this Part: (a) The term public employee means any person
holding a position by appointment or employment in the service of a public
employer. (b) The term public
employer means: (1)
the State of New

York; (2)
a county, city, town, village, or any other political subdivision or civil division of the

State; (3)
a school district or any
governmental entity operating a public school, college or university; (4)
a public improvement or special
district; (5)
a public authority, commission or public benefit corporation; or
(6)
any other public corporation, agency or
instrumentality or unit of government which exercises governmental powers under
the laws of the State. (c) The term team means any group leader, coach, official or athlete who comprises the official delegation of the United

States to world, Pan-American or Olympic competition. (d) The term world level competition means
any amateur competition between any athlete or athletes representing the United

States and any athlete or athletes representing any foreign country, where the
competition is sanctioned by the national governing body of the United States
for that sport in which the employee seeking leave under this provision plans
to compete. (e) The term

Pan-American competition means the official Pan-American games, sanctioned by
the United States Olympic Committee, in which the United States competes as a
national body. (f) The term Olympic
competition means the official Olympic games, sanctioned by the United States

Olympic Committee, in which the United States competes as a national
body. Notes
